intro: Alania endlicheri, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and succulent. Alania endlicheri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
